sentences.en: He covered the inert body with a blanket.
sentences.cn: 他用毯子把那具一动不动的尸体盖上。

sentences.en: He lay completely inert on the floor.
sentences.cn: 他一动不动地躺在地板上.

sentences.en: He lay inert in the sand.
He lay inert with half-closed eyes.
sentences.cn: 他半睁着双眼一动不动地躺着。

sentences.en: He stood inert as the car came towards him.
sentences.cn: 汽车朝他开来时,他还呆呆地站着.

sentences.en: Helium and neon are inert gases.
I carried her, still inert, up the stairs to my room.
sentences.cn: 她仍然一动也不动, 我把她抱到楼上我的房间去.

sentences.en: Inert gas studies are providing valuable information about other planets, too.
sentences.cn: 对惰性气体的研究, 也提供了有关其它行星的有价值的资料.

sentences.en: It is not necessary to replace air with inert gas.
sentences.cn: 不必用惰性气体置换空气.

sentences.en: New inert gas data from terrestrial rocks has also raised other questions about the evolving earth.
sentences.cn: 地球岩石中惰性气体的新资料,为我们提出了与演变中的地球有关的许多其它方面的问题.

sentences.en: Stone is an inert mass of matter.
sentences.cn: 石头是一块无生命的物体.

sentences.en: The alkanes are generally inert to ionic reagents.
sentences.cn: 烷烃一般说来对离子型试剂是不活泼的.

sentences.en: The novel itself remains oddly inert.
sentences.cn: 小说本身异常平淡，了无生气。

sentences.en: The sewer lines may then become clogged with inert materials.
sentences.cn: 废水管路可能被这种惰性物质堵塞.

sentences.en: What integrates so easily into both organic and inert matter.
sentences.cn: 不管是有机物还是惰性物质,水都能轻而易举地与之融合成一体.

trans.tran_cn: 迟钝的，不活泼的，[化]惰性的
trans.tran_en: not producing a chemical reaction when combined with other substances
